chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Voda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph M. Voda is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph M. Voda was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Joseph M. Voda was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing, Arraignment, Status Conference, and Initial Appearance on 04-07-16

9:32 am - 15CF14 (Sentencing), 15CF16 (Sentencing), 15CF52 (Sentencing), 16CF11 (Arraignment), 14CF17 (Status conference), 16CF14 (Initial appearance) - Defendant Joseph M. Voda appeared with attorney John Anthony Ward.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF17 - Parties stipulate to extend deferred entry of judgment.  So ordered. 16CF14 -   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Court examines defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver to be free and accepts. Court orders pre-trial. 16CF11 - Parties have received and reviewed information.  Defendant pleads NOT GUILTY.  Court orders pre-trial.  15CF14, 15CF16, 15CF52 - Parties have received and reviewed pre-sentence investigation report. Comments and recommendation by DA. Comments and recommendation by Attorney Ward. Comments by defendant. Comments and ruling by Court. Written explanation of determinate sentence provided. Defendant remanded to Price County Sheriff's Dept. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:31 am. 

Court imposes:

15CF52 (4): $758 fine; 30 day jail term, cs to any other sentence
15CF52 (5): $442 fine; 5 day jail term, cs to any other sentence, with credit of 2 days for time served; DNA sample and surcharge
90 days from release of custody to pay financial obligations or CO.

15CF14 (1): Prison term of 11 years consisting of 5 years initial confinement and 6 years of extended supervision, with credit of 1 day for time served
Conditions: Court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; Maintain full-time employment; Maintain absolute sobriety; participate in and successfully complete any assessment, treatment and counseling, as recommended by the risk assessment or as directed by the supervising agent; Psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations and/or medications; Report any prescription medications to agent within 24 hours; Payment of all court fees, supervision fees and restitution and maintain monthly payments; Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by agent. 

Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse program.


15CF16 (1): 9 month jail term, cs to any other sentence; Court costs; DNA sample and surcharge;
$60 buy money to PFPD - 90 days from release of custody to pay financial obligations or CO.

9:55 am - 15CF14, 15CF16, 15CF52, 15CT38, 14CF17 - Defendant Joseph M. Voda appeared with attorney John Anthony Ward.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA moves to withdraw motion to enter JOC on 14CF17 and amend DEJ upon stipulation.  So ordered.  15CF52 parties have received and reviewed information and waive reading. Defendant pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1 in 15CF14 and Ct. 1 in 15CF16 and on Cts. 4 & 5 in 15CF52.   Court questions DE regarding the pleas given in 15CF14, 15CF16, 15CF52.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 in 15CF14, Ct. 1 in 15CF16 and Cts. 4 & 5 in 15CF52.  DA certifies victims rights compliance on applicable counts.  On motion of DA court dismisses Cts. 2-5 in 15CF14, Cts. 1-3 in 15CF52 and Ct. 1 in 15CT38.  Court orders PSI on Ct. 1 in 15CF14 & Ct. 1 in 15CF16. Court informs defendant regarding firearms and voting. To be set for sentencing. Bonds to continue. Adj. 10:20 am.
see minutes on today's date under plea hearing event

Defendant Joseph M. Voda appeared with attorney John Anthony Ward.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE pleads NOT GUILTY to Misd. charges.  Attorney Ward provides waiver of preliminary hearing form to Court.  Court questions DE.  Court finds waiver given freely and accepts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue. Adj. 9:39 am.
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE not operate a motor vehicle unless he/she has a valid dl in their possession.  DE may not have contact with Carol Voda, unless there is written consent on file.

10:00 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 10-06-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
